intro: Tetramolopium humile subsp. haleakalae, commonly known as Haleakalae ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforest understories. It is endemic to the island of Maui, where it is found primarily on the Haleakalā volcano. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
